title: Crash discovery service with malformed WHOAREYOU packet
body:
### Description
Using a malformed RLP packet, we crash the discovery service of Teku permanently.

Attack scenario
- We identify the public key of a Teku node, from which we compute its nodeId per discv5/ENR spec.
- We craft a WHOAREYOU tag: sha256(dest-node-id || "WHOAREYOU")
- We add 0xc1c0 as the body of the message, instead of the expected data.

See https://github.com/ethereum/public-attacknets/issues/18 for additional info

Indeed the discovery service stops responding after RLP decoding error. The reason is that in discovery there is a pipeline which is build upon RX stream. When the exception occurs it is not handler neither in packet handling code nor in RX stream error handler and thus the RX stream results in being closed abruptly and stops propagating further messages
